intro: Kefersteinia lojae, commonly known as the Loja kefersteinia, is a rare and unique plant native to the Andean region of Ecuador. It is characterized by its striking, elongated leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. It thrives in high-altitude, rocky environments and requires specific conditions to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
